primary_use: Transport of equipment and specimens across Dens terrain
material_components: Wood and metal construction with reinforced axles
special_properties: Distinctive design allows navigation on unstable Densground; some versions have seventy sides
hazard_notes: May attract Dens creatures due to vibration patterns
notes: The Mapmaker's cart famously has five women roped to it; Vagabu Olt uses modified version

primary_use: Tracking creatures and expeditions in Dens region
special_properties: Glow green when activated; emit sonic signals for remote tracking
hazard_notes: May interfere with creature behavior - use with caution near sensitive species
notes: Used in modern expeditions; replace earlier less reliable tracking methods

special_properties: Designed to preserve creature specimens during transport; various sizes available
hazard_notes: Some creatures can escape untreated bags - always use Guild-approved treatments

primary_use: Capturing creatures in various environments - tunnels surface and unusual shapes
material_components: Wood and metal - deliberately imperfect construction
special_properties: Deliberately made 'wrong' - corners not square, edges not flush; creatures enter more readily; three types for different situations
hazard_notes: Improper placement may collapse tunnels; may capture unintended creatures
notes: Three main types: tunnel traps for burrows, box traps for surface, spherical for unusual body shapes; all share 'wrong' construction principle

material_components: Twist of black bark or tarred rope
hazard_notes: Handle with care - magical objects may have unexpected effects
notes: Found in Dens region; purposes range from protection to curse-work

hazard_notes: May have connection to Dens creatures - study ongoing
notes: Unusual artifact of unclear purpose; may connect W1/W2

special_properties: Allows wielder to flatten city blocks - extreme power
hazard_notes: Extremely dangerous - responsible for major destruction
notes: Kera Qine acquired accidentally; demonstrates Dens region supernatural hazards

special_properties: Densbone skulls particularly valued; unknown properties
hazard_notes: May carry Dens-origin effects - handle carefully
notes: Major trade item; some believe has supernatural properties

special_properties: Underground comicbooks about Quarry life; used in church readings
hazard_notes: Content may be considered subversive by Capital
notes: Bridge object - appears in both W1 Quarry context and W2 religious settings

special_properties: Standard Guild-approved equipment following Three-Compassed Map protocol
hazard_notes: Standard equipment poses no unusual hazards
notes: Does not include East-pointing instruments per Three-Compassed Map doctrine

special_properties: Archive manuscript identifiers - MS-prefix numbering system
hazard_notes: Some manuscripts may contain dangerous knowledge - access restricted
notes: Standard Archive numbering for manuscript holdings

material_components: Living aureate creatures - gold with red spots
special_properties: Used for tracking - follow targets through Dens terrain
hazard_notes: Living creatures require care and feeding
notes: Biological alternative to mechanical tracking balls

special_properties: Official hazard reporting document - feeds into Guild records
notes: Standard form for documenting dangerous locations during surveys
